content.description: On the front face of the formation, follow obvious weaknesses past one bolt on a slabby face to an overhang. Pass the overhang (bolt; crux) to gain a right facing groove that leads to the top. Rappel or lower from the anchor with one 60m rope.
content.protection: Two bolts, gear up to a green Camalot, a couple long slings. Anchor on top. You'll want a cordelette if you plan to TR this route.
content.location:
Rest Widge (sic) climbs the front of the small tower (Duffer Peak) that is to the left of the Matterhorn. Approach from the road as for the Matterhorn, then traverse left 40 or so yards to the front of this formation. 

 Start in the center of the narrow face that faces the highway. There is a large pine tree near the base.

content.description: This small tower sits about 40 yards left of the Matterhorn. The tower has two natural arches on its right and uphill sides. Named after Dufour Peak (aka Dufourspitze), which is located next to the ______ in Switzerland.
